snippet: About 2,200 pounds of gum, chewed and stuck to a brick wall near Pike Place Market, captivates and repulses visitors, but it has also endangered the wall itself.
abstract: Seattle Journal; Pike Place Market officials, citing structural damage, begin cleaning 20-year accumulation of chewed gum off 115-year-old brick wall, display that had become one of city's strangest tourist destinations.
lead_paragraph: About 2,200 pounds of gum, chewed and stuck to a brick wall near Pike Place Market, captivates and repulses visitors, but it has also endangered the wall itself.

headline.print_headline: Nostalgia Aside, It’s Time to Tear Down This Gum
headline.main: Saying Goodbye a Little Longer as Seattle Scrapes Off Its Gum Wall
